publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-767# Ms Sandra White: Glasgow Regeneration—That the Parliament notes with concern recent reports highlighting the levels of ill health and poverty in Glasgow and the widening health gap between Glasgow and more prosperous parts of the country; believes that a co-ordinated strategy should be developed to tackle these problems and recognises that the injection of public investment is required for the regeneration of the city.

S1M-767# Ms Sandra White: Glasgow Regeneration—That the Parliament notes with concern recent reports highlighting the levels of ill health and poverty in Glasgow and the widening wealth gap between Glasgow and more prosperous parts of the country; believes that a co-ordinated strategy should be developed to tackle these problems and recognises that the injection of public investment is required for the regeneration of the city.
S1M-767# Glasgow Regeneration (lodged on 19 April 2000) Fergus Ewing*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-767# Glasgow Regeneration (lodged on 19 April 2000) Andrew Wilson*, Alex Neil*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Christine Grahame*

S1M-767# Ms Sandra White: Glasgow Regeneration—That the Parliament notes with concern recent reports highlighting the levels of ill health and poverty in Glasgow and the widening wealth gap between Glasgow and more prosperous parts of the country; believes that a co-ordinated strategy should be developed to tackle these problems and recognises that the injection of public investment is required for the regeneration of the city. Supported by: Fergus Ewing, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Andrew Wilson, Alex Neil, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Christine Grahame
S1M-767# Glasgow Regeneration (lodged on 19 April 2000) Robert Brown*
S1M-767# Glasgow Regeneration (lodged on 19 April 2000) Donald Gorrie*

S1M-767# Ms Sandra White: Glasgow Regeneration—That the Parliament notes with concern recent reports highlighting the levels of ill health and poverty in Glasgow and the widening wealth gap between Glasgow and more prosperous parts of the country; believes that a co-ordinated strategy should be developed to tackle these problems and recognises that the injection of public investment is required for the regeneration of the city. Supported by: Fergus Ewing, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Andrew Wilson, Alex Neil, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Christine Grahame, Robert Brown, Donald Gorrie
S1M-767# Glasgow Regeneration (lodged on 19 April 2000) Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-767# Glasgow Regeneration (lodged on 19 April 2000) Mr John McAllion*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*

S1M-767# Ms Sandra White: Glasgow Regeneration-That the Parliament notes with concern recent reports highlighting the levels of ill health and poverty in Glasgow and the widening wealth gap between Glasgow and more prosperous parts of the country; believes that a co-ordinated strategy should be developed to tackle these problems and recognises that the injection of public investment is required for the regeneration of the city. Supported by: Fergus Ewing, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Andrew Wilson, Alex Neil, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Christine Grahame, Robert Brown, Donald Gorrie, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr John McAllion, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S1M-767# Glasgow Regeneration (lodged on 19 April 2000) Linda Fabiani*

S1M-767# Ms Sandra White: Glasgow Regeneration—That the Parliament notes with concern recent reports highlighting the levels of ill health and poverty in Glasgow and the widening wealth gap between Glasgow and more prosperous parts of the country; believes that a co-ordinated strategy should be developed to tackle these problems and recognises that the injection of public investment is required for the regeneration of the city. Supported by: Fergus Ewing, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Andrew Wilson, Alex Neil, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Christine Grahame, Robert Brown, Donald Gorrie, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr John McAllion, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Linda Fabiani

S1M-767# Ms Sandra White: Glasgow Regeneration—That the Parliament notes with concern recent reports highlighting the levels of ill health and poverty in Glasgow and the widening wealth gap between Glasgow and more prosperous parts of the country; believes that a co-ordinated strategy should be developed to tackle these problems and recognises that the injection of public investment is required for the regeneration of the city. Supported by: Fergus Ewing, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Andrew Wilson, Alex Neil, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Christine Grahame, Robert Brown, Donald Gorrie, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr John McAllion, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Linda Fabiani
S1M-767# Glasgow Regeneration (lodged on 19 April 2000) Michael Matheson*

S1M-767# Ms Sandra White: Glasgow Regeneration-That the Parliament notes with concern recent reports highlighting the levels of ill health and poverty in Glasgow and the widening wealth gap between Glasgow and more prosperous parts of the country; believes that a co-ordinated strategy should be developed to tackle these problems and recognises that the injection of public investment is required for the regeneration of the city. Supported by: Fergus Ewing, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Andrew Wilson, Alex Neil, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Christine Grahame, Robert Brown, Donald Gorrie, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr John McAllion, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Linda Fabiani, Michael Matheson, Mr Kenny MacAskill*
